class ApiMetaDataEntity():
    """Class model for the ApiMetaDataEntity table"""
    def __init__(
            self, 
            partition_key, 
            row_key, 
            timestamp, 
            bronze_latest_path = None, 
            enabled = None, 
            index = None, 
            method = None, 
            next_cursor = None, 
            record_count_to_request = None, 
            silver_latest_delta_path = None, 
            silver_latest_full_path = None,
            gold_latest_delta_path = None, 
            gold_latest_full_path = None,            
            version = None, 
            Path = None
        ):
        self.partition_key = partition_key
        self.row_key = row_key
        self.timestamp = timestamp
        self.bronze_latest_path = bronze_latest_path
        self.enabled = enabled
        self.index = index
        self.method = method
        self.next_cursor = next_cursor
        self.record_count_to_request = record_count_to_request
        self.silver_latest_delta_path = silver_latest_delta_path
        self.silver_latest_full_path = silver_latest_full_path
        self.gold_latest_delta_path = gold_latest_delta_path
        self.gold_latest_full_path = gold_latest_full_path        
        self.version = version

    @classmethod
    def from_dict(cls, entity_dict):
        """
        Takes in an api metadata dictionary and returns a constructed api metadata class

            Parameters:
            data (Dict): dictionary containing class values as key value paris

            Returns:
            constructed class
        """           
        return cls(
            partition_key = entity_dict.get('PartitionKey'),
            row_key = entity_dict.get('RowKey'),
            timestamp = entity_dict.get('Timestamp'),
            bronze_latest_path = entity_dict.get("BronzeLatestPath", ""),
            enabled = entity_dict.get("Enabled", ""),
            index = entity_dict.get("Index", 0),
            method = entity_dict.get("Method", ""),            
            next_cursor = entity_dict.get("NextCursor", ""),
            record_count_to_request = entity_dict.get("RecordCountToRequest", 0),
            silver_latest_delta_path = entity_dict.get("SilverLatestDeltaPath", ""),
            silver_latest_full_path = entity_dict.get("SilverLatestFullPath", ""),
            gold_latest_delta_path = entity_dict.get("GoldLatestDeltaPath", ""),
            gold_latest_full_path = entity_dict.get("GoldLatestFullPath", ""),            
            version = entity_dict.get("Version", 0),
        )

    def to_dict(self):
        """
        Converts api metadata class to a dictionary
        Create & Update Table operations only accept a dictionary

            Returns:
            dictionary with class values
        """    
        return {
            "PartitionKey": self.partition_key,
            "RowKey": self.row_key,
            "Timestamp": self.timestamp,
            "BronzeLatestPath": self.bronze_latest_path,
            "Enabled": self.enabled,
            "Index": self.index,
            "Method": self.method,
            "NextCursor": self.next_cursor,
            "RecordCountToRequest": self.record_count_to_request,
            "SilverLatestDeltaPath": self.silver_latest_delta_path,
            "SilverLatestFullPath": self.silver_latest_full_path,
            "GoldLatestDeltaPath": self.gold_latest_delta_path,
            "GoldLatestFullPath": self.gold_latest_full_path,            
            "Version": self.version
